1.name: Holiday
1.description: A young man in love with a girl from a rich family finds his unorthodox plan to go on holiday for the early years of his life met with skepticism by everyone except for his fiancée's eccentric sister and long-suffering brother.

2.name: The Lady Vanishes
2.description: While travelling in continental Europe, a rich young playgirl realizes that an elderly lady seems to have disappeared from the train.

3.name: The Adventures of Robin Hood
3.description: When Prince John and the Norman Lords begin oppressing the Saxon masses in King Richard's absence, a Saxon lord fights back as the outlaw leader of a rebel guerrilla army.

4.name: Bringing Up Baby
4.description: While trying to secure a $1 million donation for his museum, a befuddled paleontologist is pursued by a flighty and often irritating heiress and her pet leopard, Baby.

5.name: You Can't Take It with You
5.description: A man from a family of rich snobs becomes engaged to a woman from a good-natured but decidedly eccentric family.

6.name: Pygmalion
6.description: A phonetics and diction expert makes a bet that he can teach a cockney flower girl to speak proper English and pass as a lady in high society.

7.name: Two-Gun Man from Harlem
7.description: A cowboy is wrongfully accused of murder. He winds up in Harlem, where he assumes the identity of a preacher-turned-gangster who looks like him. He infiltrates the gang to catch the men who...                See full summary »

8.name: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
8.description: Tom Sawyer and his pal Huckleberry Finn have great adventures on the Mississippi River, pretending to be pirates, attending their own funeral and witnessing a murder.

9.name: Angels with Dirty Faces
9.description: A priest tries to stop a gangster from corrupting a group of street kids.

10.name: Jezebel
10.description: In 1850s Louisiana, a free-spirited Southern belle loses her fiancé due to her stubborn vanity and pride, and vows to win him back.

11.name: Block-Heads
11.description: Stan, who has remained faithfully at his World War I post for twenty years, finally comes home where his best friend, Ollie, takes him in, thus allowing him to discover the many conveniences of the modern world.

12.name: Algiers
12.description: Beautiful Gaby meets a romantic jewel thief in the mysterious Casbah.

13.name: Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
13.description: After learning her multi-millionaire fiancé has already been married seven times, the daughter of a penniless marquis decides to tame him.

14.name: Marie Antoinette
14.description: The tragic life of Marie Antoinette, who became queen of France in her late teens.

15.name: Boys Town
15.description: When a death row prisoner tells him he wouldn't have led a life of crime if only he had had one friend as a child, Father Edward Flanagan decides to do something about. An advocate of child...                See full summary »

16.name: Le quai des brumes
16.description: A military deserter finds love and trouble (and a small dog) in a smoky French port city.

17.name: A Christmas Carol
17.description: On Christmas Eve, an old miser named Ebenezer Scrooge is visited by the spirit of his former partner, Jacob Marley. The deceased partner was in his lifetime as mean and miserly as Scrooge ...                See full summary »

18.name: Vivacious Lady
18.description: A professor marries a nightclub singer, much to the consternation of his family and friends back home.

19.name: Aleksandr Nevskiy
19.description: The story of how a great Russian prince led a ragtag army to battle an invading force of Teutonic Knights.

20.name: La bête humaine
20.description: In this classic adaptation of Emile Zola's novel, a tortured train engineer falls in love with a troubled married woman who has helped her husband commit a murder.

21.name: Swiss Miss
21.description: Stanley and Oliver are mousetrap salesmen hoping to strike it rich in Switzerland, but get swindled out of all their money by a cheesemaker. While working off their hotel debt, Oliver falls...                See full summary »

22.name: Flash Gordon's Trip to Mars
22.description: When a deadly Nitron ray strikes Earth, Flash Gordon and his friends travel to Mars to battle Ming the Merciless and his new ally Queen Azura.

23.name: Carefree
23.description: A psychiatrist agrees to hypnotize his friend's girlfriend in order to convince her to accept his proposals of marriage, but she ends up falling for the psychiatrist instead.

24.name: Bar 20 Justice
24.description: Outlaw miners have been stealing ore from Ann Dennis' mine. Hoppy spends much of his time running around in the mine shafts tracking down the crooks.

25.name: The Dawn Patrol
25.description: British flying aces in World War I contend with the harsh realities of war.

26.name: Blondie
26.description: Dagwood loses his job on the eve of his and Blondie's fifth wedding anniversary.

27.name: The Baroness and the Butler
27.description: A butler gets elected to the Hungarian parliament where he opposes his master's government.

28.name: In Old Chicago
28.description: The O'Leary brothers -- honest Jack and roguish Dion -- become powerful figures, and eventually rivals, in Chicago on the eve of its Great Fire.

29.name: The Divorce of Lady X
29.description: Divorce lawyer Everard Logan thinks the woman who spent the night in his hotel room is the erring wife of his new client.

30.name: Merrily We Live
30.description: Dizzy society matron Emily Kilbourne has a habit of hiring ex-cons and hobos as servants. Her latest find is a handsome "tramp" who shows up at her doorstep and soon ends up in a ...                See full summary »

31.name: Topper Takes a Trip
31.description: To gain entry to Heaven, a ghost attempts to reunite a divorcing couple as a good deed.

32.name: Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm
32.description: Rebecca's Uncle Harry leaves her with Aunt Miranda who forbids her to associate with show people. But neighbor Anthony Kent is a talent scout who secretly set it up for her to broadcast.

33.name: Love Finds Andy Hardy
33.description: Andy has problems raising the last payment for a used car and juggling three pretty girls with an upcoming country club dance scheduled.

34.name: Swing!
34.description: Ted Gregory is trying to be the first black producer to mount a show on Broadway, but he has trouble with his star singer.

35.name: Four Daughters
35.description: Adam Lemp, the Dean of the Briarwood Music Foundation, has passed on his love of music to his four early adult daughters - Thea, Emma, Kay and Ann - who live with him and his sister, the ...                See full summary »

36.name: Child Bride
36.description: Schoolteacher in a rural community campaigns to stop the practice of older men marrying young, underage girls.

37.name: The Citadel
37.description: Andrew Manson, a young, enthusiastic doctor takes his first job in a Welsh mining town, and begins to wonder at the persistent cough many of the miners have. When his attempts to prove its ...                See full summary »

38.name: Room Service
38.description: A penniless theatrical producer must outwit the hotel efficiency expert trying to evict him from his room, while securing a backer for his new play.

39.name: The Big Broadcast of 1938
39.description: The Bellows family causes comic confusion on an ocean liner, with time out for radio-style musical acts.

40.name: The Lone Ranger
40.description: CHAP. 1, HI YO SILVER: An outlaw leader planning to take control of Texas after the Civil War kills Colonel Jeffries, a man empowered to levy taxes, and assumes his identity. His men then ...                See full summary »

41.name: The Terror of Tiny Town
41.description: An evil gunslinging midget comes to terrorize the good little people of Tiny Town. The townspeople organize to defeat him, and zany antics ensue

42.name: The Buccaneer
42.description: Semi-fictional account of pirate Jean Lafitte's involvement in the War of 1812.

43.name: The Amazing Dr. Clitterhouse
43.description: A brilliant Park Avenue doctor becomes a criminal in order to do research into the criminal mind.

44.name: The Mad Miss Manton
44.description: When the murdered body discovered by beautiful, vivacious socialite Melsa Manton disappears, police and press label her a prankster until she proves them wrong.

45.name: Always Goodbye
45.description: A woman must decide between two men - one she loves, the other she admires and respects.

46.name: Too Much Johnson
46.description: A woman has two lovers. When one man finds out about the other, he acts as a villain and chases after the protagonist.

47.name: Alexander's Ragtime Band
47.description: This send-up of ragtime song and dance begins in 1915 San Francisco when society boy Roger Grant decides to pursue popular rather than serious music.

48.name: La femme du boulanger
48.description: A small village rejoices at the arrival of a new baker. But when his young wife runs off with another man, he is unable to keep baking and the village is thrown into disarray.

49.name: Charlie Chan in Honolulu
49.description: While Charlie is distracted with the birth of his first grandchild, son Jimmy impersonates his father in order to investigate a murder aboard a freighter in the harbor.

50.name: Prison Break
50.description: Joaquin Shannon arrives home from a cruise on his fishing boat. His first mate, Charles Nelson, is to marry Shannon's sister the next day. Nelson gets drunk and Shannon finds him near the ...                See full summary »
